comment.author: 29137109@N00
comment._content:
I'm stuggling to determine where this is in Newtown, from the bottom half of the building on the very right,  it looks like the photo could have been taken from the High Street and looking up to what's now Shortbridge Street, if this is the case, the J. Palmer's Humber Cycles building would have completely disappeared, replaced by a road and behind it now serves as the town centre clock and Barclays Bank.

The next time I pass I will take a photo for comparison.

comment.author: 17958931@N00
comment._content: It looks as if you're right! I'd say  that the town clock and Barclays is situated where the J.Palmer shop is in this photo. It is very confusing!!

comment.author: 29137109@N00
comment._content: I have taken a photo of the same area as it was in July 2009. There's quite a difference, but I'm 99% certain it's the same location. I couldn't get the angle identical because there would have been a phone box in the way.

comment.realname: Llyfrgell Genedlaethol Cymru  / The National Library of Wales
comment.author: 37199428@N06
comment._content:
Hi,
Thanks for your comments and also for taking this additional photograph. I'm sure that the Flicker enthusiasts will be interested in comparing both images.
